III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162 Seclusion Rooms; administrative oversight.
Section (11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Description
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is being secluded at facility in response to behavioral
issues. Youth was isolated for 1.5 months and has been kept in a
part of the facility that is not part of their program.
Investigation I interviewed Staff 1/complainant via telephone on 2/15/23 and
confirmed the information in the allegations.
An additional complaint came in on 2/21/23 regarding Youth A. I
interviewed Second Complainant/Former Staff 3 via telephone on
2/22/23 and confirmed the information in the allegations. Second
Complainant/Former Staff 3 reported similar concerns as
Complainant/Staff 1 including Youth A being secluded, not having
access to clean clothing and not attending school. She also
reported that Youth A is secluded unjustly due to her race and
size and that Youth A is not allowed access to her therapist when
she wants it.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/16/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth A reported that
she does not feel safe at the facility as she has been secluded for
over a month in the emergency intake wing and has been unable
to participate in programming, school, or groups. Youth A reported
she has trouble getting clean clothes and towels and often has to
wait for staff to go and get these items for her. Youth A reported
she has a bedroom, bathroom, sensory room and outdoor area in
the emergency intake wing. Youth A reported she is being
discriminated against as she is the only Juvenile Justice youth at
the facility. Youth A reported she had an incident where she
flipped two tables and on 1/11/23 she was separated from the
other youth since that time. Youth A reported other youth in the
program flip over tables but do not get separated from everyone
else. Youth A reported the psychiatrist and therapist decide who
2

gets secluded and the length. Youth A reported she is separated
because she does not take her medication. Youth A then reported
several issues with how her medication is prescribed and how she
isn't going to take it all day long. Youth A reported she feels
forced to take her medication and has no say in what is
prescribed. Youth A then reported she takes her medication as
prescribed now and is still separated. Youth A then stated she
refused her medication the last two days because she didn't like
the staff member who was dispensing it. Youth A reported she
and her therapist don't sit down and talk about her situation.
Youth A reported that she and her therapist "do not see eye to
eye". Youth A reported her therapist brings another staff member
with her to the sessions and she does not like that. Youth A
denied she and her therapist have ever had any incidents or
problems.
The Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/16/23 in collaboration with the Government Worker and the
Rights Officer. The Therapist reported that she attempts to meet
with Youth A between 3 and 4 times a week. Youth A tells her
she does not want therapy and Youth A has never requested to
see her. The Therapist reported that Youth A refuses to
participate in her medication reviews with the psychiatrist and if
she does attend the review Youth A refuses to talk to the
psychiatrist. The therapist reported that Youth A receives all
programs while in the emergency intake wing (Dreams, Journey to
Success, virtual school and therapy). The services are brought to
her in the emergency wing. The therapist reported she has tried
several ways to engage with Youth A via talk therapy, worksheets
and journaling. The therapist reported that she is part of the team
that meets weekly and determines the placement of Youth A. The
reason for her current placement is due to her refusal to take her
medication, her refusal to participate in her medication reviews,
her quick volatile aggression and the need to keep Youth A, staff
and other youth safe. The therapist reported the psychiatrist is
trying to stabilize Youth A so that she can interact appropriately
with others. The therapist recommends placement of Youth A in
the emergency wing at this time for the safety of staff and youth.
The therapist reported Youth A has threatened to kill her and to kill
her son who is 2.5 years old. There was an incident when Youth A
ran at the Therapist with her hands out trying to hit her when
Youth A was upset about court. The Therapist does not interact
with Youth A alone due to her verbal and physical aggression
towards her.
3

I interviewed the Director of Integrated Behavioral Health at the
facility on 2/16/22 in collaboration with the Government Worker.
She reported they have an integrated behavior health meeting
weekly that includes Youth A's therapist, psychiatrist, DHHS staff,
probation officer and the journey to success team. Youth A's plan
and placement is reviewed and determined at this meeting each
week. She described this meeting as a proactive meeting. The
Director reported that Youth A has been placed in the emergency
wing since 1/11/23 after an incident that involved Youth A being
physically and verbally aggressive and flipping tables that required
the police to be called to gain control of the situation. Youth A had
had several incidents of physical and verbal aggression prior to
this incident, and it was determined for the safety of other youth
and staff she be placed in the emergency wing for an alternative
programming location. The Director reported Youth A receives
the same programming as the other youth and she does not miss
out on any of her services. The Director indicated Youth A
receives therapy services but typically refuses them. She
receives psychiatric services that she refuses to attend or
participate in. She receives virtual schooling and the journey to
success program. The Director reported Youth A has made it
known that she is just riding out her stay at the facility and doesn't
need this place or the services. Youth A will be 18 in May and
plans to be discharged at that time. The Director reported they are
always looking at reintegrating Youth A each week based on her
behaviors. The facility feels it is important to work towards
integration as they do not want to release her to the community
without integration.
The Rights Officer was interviewed on 2/16/23 face to face in
collaboration with the Government Worker. He reported that
Youth A is on a 2:1 specialized plan based on her psychiatrist and
therapists' recommendation. The Rights Officer reported that
Youth A does leave the building and campus to go to doctor
appointments, dental appointments and has left for a psychiatric
evaluation. He reported Youth A has multiple delinquency and
assault charges for fighting. Youth A has a history of multiple
verbal and physical aggression while at the facility. The Rights
Officer reported that Youth A is not very compliant with her
medication often refusing to take it. He sees Youth A three times
a week as he is the PREA representative at the facility. He sees
Youth A and asks if she is having any issues. He reported she
has not filed or expressed any complaints in 2023. The Rights
Officer reported he did receive a grievance in 2022 from Youth A
that said "I hate my fucking therapist". The Rights Officer reported
the therapist will not meet with Youth A alone as she has
4

threatened to kill her. The Rights Officer reported Youth A told
another resident she was going to "ring her therapist's neck".
The Rights Officer reported that Youth A is court ordered to take
her medication and has not been compliant. She refused her
medication the past two days and when reviewing her compliance
in December she refused her medication 27 times. The Rights
Officer reported Youth A is not the only Juvenile Justice child in
the program at the facility.
A tour of the intake wing occurred on 2/16/23. The space has a
separate bedroom, full bathroom with shower, a separate sensory
room and a hallway which has a table that can be used as a desk.
There is also a fenced in outdoor space with picnic tables that
Youth A has access to use.
Documentation Reviewed:
Youth A' treatment plan was reviewed, and she is receiving the
services in her treatment plan in the emergency wing.
Incident report dated 1/10/23 authored by Therapist-Youth A told
another youth she was going to go over to her therapist’s office to
kill her while making a strangulation gesture with her hands and a
pretend rope. The client said Youth A acted out how she would
kill her therapist by pretending she had a rope in her hand, and
she would sneak up behind her chair and strangle her with a rope.
Incident reports were reviewed involving Youth A from 11/11/22
through 2/15/23. There were 21 incident reports that detailed
extremely violent physical and verbal aggression, threats of harm,
fighting with youth and staff, screaming, throwing furniture,
punching youth and staff multiple times, and destroying property
(holes in walls, tearing phone out of the wall, dumping salt all over
the living area, flipping the table with her laptop on it, flooding the
wing by placing towels, blankets and books in the toilet multiple
times. Youth A was taken to the hospital by police due to
extreme physical and verbal aggression on 12/14/22, 1/11/23,
1/11/23 (twice that day) and 1/30/23.
Youth A’s medication logs from February 2023 were reviewed.
Youth A has refused to take one of her psychotropic medications
12 times and the other psychotropic medication 14 times.
The reintegration plan was reviewed. Youth A's plan for
reintegration began on 3/1/23. Youth A will go back into the milieu
with a 2:1 staffing ratio on 3/1/23.
5

The facilities Behavior Management Policy was reviewed. The
facility does not use seclusion which is described as preventing a
client's egress from a designated area. The facility utilizes
segregation for safety which is used to regain control or to de-
escalate a crisis situation. It is not intended to last for prolonged
periods of time.
PA 116 definition of seclusion is the involuntary placement of a
minor child in a room alone, where the minor child is prevented
from exiting by any means, including the physical presence of a
staff person if the sole purpose of that staff person's presence is to
prevent the minor child from exiting the room. Seclusion does not
include the use of a sleeping room during regular sleeping hours
to ensure security precaution appropriate to the condition and
circumstances of a minor child placed in the child caring institution
as a result of an order of the family division of circuit court under
section 2(a) and (b) of chapter XIIA of the probate code of 1939,
1939PA 288 MCL 712A.2 if the minor child's individual case
treatment plan indicates that the security precautions would be in
the minor child's best interest.
Analysis Based upon interviews and review of documentation there is no
evidence that supports Youth A is being secluded. Youth A is
placed in a separate wing from other youth for the safety of herself
and others. She has access to the wing which includes a
bedroom, full bathroom, sensory room, desk/table/computer, and
outdoor space. She is receiving all services outlined in her
treatment plan in this wing and has two staff with her. Her
placement in the wing is evaluated weekly and has been
determined necessary by her psychiatrist and therapist due to
physical and verbal aggression and her noncompliance with taking
her medication.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4125 Personal possessions; money; clothing;
Section storage space.
Description (1) A licensee shall have a written policy that designates all of the
following:
(c) The method for ensuring that each resident has sufficient
clean, properly fitting, seasonal clothing.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A does not have clean clothes.
Investigation Youth A, Complainant/Staff 1, and Complainant/Former Staff 3
reported Youth A does not have clean clothing and Youth A
cannot leave the area to wash her clothing. Complainant Staff 1
6

reported she brought Youth A clothing and washed her clothing.
Youth A reported getting her clean clothing can take time each
day and sometimes she doesn't get her clothing until mid-morning.
Youth A reported she does not have clean towels as needed.
I interviewed the Director of Integrated Behavioral Health on
2/16/23 at the facility in collaboration with the Government
Worker. She reported there is a washer and dryer right outside
Youth A's living space, and it is utilized to wash her clothing. She
reported staff wash Youth A's clothing, and it is provided to her
daily. The director reported there is also a cabinet full of towels in
the space that Youth A resides.
I interviewed Team Leader 1 at the facility on 2/16/23. He has
been employed as a Team Leader for three years. He reported
that Youth A has clean clothes and towels available to her daily.
He reported dirty towels are placed in a bag and removed weekly
and replaced with clean towels. He reported Youth A has flooded
the area she resides in between 4-5 times by placing all of her
available towels and bedding in the toilet and shower drains.
Team Leader 1 reported there is never an issue with having clean
clothes or towels for Youth A.
When I interviewed Youth A she had on clean clothing. There
were clean towels observed in her bathroom.
Analysis Based upon interviews there is no evidence that supports Youth A
does not have clean towels or that she has to wait to get clean
clothing each day. In this case, Youth A only reported that it took
longer (mid-morning) some days for her to get her clean clothes,
and not that she did not have clean clothes.
CONSULTATION:
It is recommended that the facility log or otherwise track when
youth are provided clean clothes/towels.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4123 Education
Section (2) Provision shall be made for an appropriate education program
Description in accordance with 1976 PA 451, MCL 380.1 to 380.1853. Each
resident of school age shall be enrolled not later than 5 school
days after admission and continuously thereafter.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A is not attending school.
7

Investigation Youth A reported she is in virtual school and has been for the past
3 weeks. Youth A reported for approximately 2 weeks she was
not in school when she was initially placed in the emergency
intake wing. Youth A reported the psychiatrist had to write a letter
to give permission for Youth A to have a computer.
Director A was interviewed on 2/16/23 at the facility in
collaboration with the Government Worker and the agency Rights
Officer. The Director reported that Youth A is in virtual school,
and it did take some time to get her into virtual school due to
concerns with permission for Youth A to have a laptop. The
psychiatrist had to write a letter verifying she would be safe with
the laptop and not destroy it. Youth A has been in virtual school
since the permission was granted approximately 3 weeks.
The Rights Officer reported on 3/1/23 that an Educational
Specialist was working with Youth A in the wing while they were
working out the waiver/paperwork for her computer. Youth A was
also provided with worksheets to keep her on track with her
classes.
Analysis Based upon interviews there is no evidence to support Youth A
was not attending school. Youth A reported she had been in
virtual school for three weeks and there was a two-week period
that she was not in virtual school due to needing a computer.
During that time Youth A was provided with worksheets,
schoolwork and an educational specialist worked with her to
ensure she was receiving educational services.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation A staff member has spoken inappropriately to youth regarding
sexuality.
Investigation During the course of this investigation, Youth A reported she does
not feel comfortable with Staff 2 as he has made inappropriate
sexual statements to her. Youth A reported Staff 2 asked her and
a staff member if they have ever had a gay moment, and he asked
another staff and Youth A if they thought another staff member
was gay. Youth A also said Staff 2 commented "he is kinda cute"
when Youth A was talking about another staff member. Youth A
reported she has told all the supervisors that she is not
8

comfortable with Staff 2 and he was in her wing working 2-3
weeks ago.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 2/28/23 in collaboration with
the Government Worker. He reported he has been employed as a
Youth Counselor at the facility since November 2022. Staff 2
reported he has not worked with Youth A in approximately 3
weeks as Youth A made a poster of him with derogatory
statements on it. She also was being aggressive with him during
the shift indicating she did not want him working in her wing and
that she was going to beat him up. Staff 2 reported a separation
plan was made after that incident and he no longer works with
Youth A. Staff 2 was unsure if the plan was put in writing, and he
could not remember the name of the staff person who the plan
was done with. Staff 2 indicated that at times he has "adult"
conversations while working when away from the youth and he
thinks Youth A overheard him. Staff 2 reported he did ask another
staff member if they ever had a gay moment. Staff 2 denied
asking Youth A this question. Staff 2 reported he did comment
"he is kind of cute" when Youth A was talking about a staff
member. Staff 2 denied that he asked Youth A or another staff if
they thought a particular staff member was gay.
The Rights Officer reported that Staff 2 requested he not work with
Youth A due to derogatory comments she made to him. Staff 2 no
longer works in the emergency wing. A copy of the separation
plan was requested, and the Rights Officer reported this was not
completed in a written format. The Rights Officer reported that
Youth A was using homophobic slurs and derogatory statements
about Staff 2 and the plan for separation was put in place around
2/9/23.
Documentation reviewed:
Incident report dated 1/19/23 in the intake wing authored by Team
Leader 1. Staff 2 entered the intake wing and Youth A began to
yell and scream about Staff 2 being present on the wing. Staff 2
did not say anything in response. Youth A then cursed and said
"Y'all keep bringing these bitches back here and I do not like him "
and "I do not want him on my wing". Staff 2 left, and they
discovered he had gone to the wrong wing and did not return to
the intake wing.
I reviewed the employee behavior policy-employees are expected
to demonstrate behavior that exhibits respectful and professional
boundaries at all times.
9

Analysis Based upon interviews there is no evidence that supports Staff 2
made inappropriate sexual comments to Youth A. He did report
he had an adult conversation with a coworker that Youth A
overheard, and he commented on a coworker's looks. Staff 2
reported he did not ask Youth A about another staff member’s
sexuality.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Staff 2 admitted to having an adult conversation with a coworker
that was overheard by Youth A and that he commented on a
coworker's looks. These are not appropriate conversations for
youth to be hearing and should not occur when working directly
with youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4151 Emergency; continuity of operation
Section procedures.
Description
(1) A child caring institution must establish and follow written
emergency procedures that have been approved by the
department that maintain the continuity of operations for a
minimum of 72 hours to ensure the safety of youth for the following
circumstances:
(c) Medical emergencies.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A's unit was not cleaned after Covid was in the building.
Investigation The complainant reported that Youth A’s wing was not cleaned
after they had Covid-19 in the building.
Youth A reported two staff in the building were Covid positive and
had contact with her in her wing. Youth A reported part of the
building she resides in was cleaned/sprayed for Covid and her
wing was not cleaned/sprayed down for Covid. Youth A reported
she was told there was no reason to clean/spray her wing.
The Director of Integrated Behavior Health handles all Covid
related issues at the facility. She reported she handles all reports
of Covid with staff and youth, does contract tracing, and
determines if cleaning of an area is needed. The Director
reported no staff in Youth A's wing had Covid. There was no
reason to have Youth A's wing cleaned/sprayed.
Team Leader 1 reported he had no knowledge of Covid exposure
in Youth A's wing or a need for the area to be sprayed or cleaned.
10

Document reviewed:
Covid 19 Category 3 level cleaning. The policy states that when
Covid has been in a wing or area of the facility, a category 3 level
cleaning will occur.
Analysis Based on interviews there is no evidence to support Youth A was
exposed to Covid or that her wing needed to be cleaned/sprayed
for Covid. The facility appears to have followed their emergency
procedure.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & 400.4109 Program statement.
Section Rule 109. (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision, methods for addressing residents needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A is not receiving therapy.
Investigation During the course of the original investigation, Youth A reported
that she does not sit down with her therapist to talk about her
situation. Youth A reported that her therapist brings someone with
her when she attempts to do therapy and she does not like this.
The Therapist reported that Youth A has threatened to physically
harm her and her two-year-old son. Youth A has also run at her
therapist in an attempt to harm her. Youth A's Therapist reported
she attempts to do therapy with Youth A multiple times a week
and she refuses therapy. The Therapist reported that Youth A tells
her she doesn't want therapy and refuses to participate.
Documentation reviewed:
Review of facilities program statement-program provides weekly
individual therapy to the youth.
Review of Youth A's treatment plan - includes a treatment goal for
individual therapy.
Review of Youth A’s therapy records -Youth A if offered therapy
twice weekly and has refused therapy 28 times from late
November 2022 through March 2023.
11

Analysis Based upon interviews and documents reviewed there is no
evidence that supports Youth A does not receive therapy services.
Youth A is refusing the services being offered to her.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
